storyInfo: Most of the Tarans who followed Reed have chosen to keep fighting. At the same time, Eblana and the Duke of Wellington gaze out upon the horizon onboard a high-speed battleship. Dublinn's army is ready.

attributes.content: Harmonie's status as a spy has been confirmed, but the intelligence personnel she planted have all evacuated in advance under her cover.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The Infected is indeed another Draco. Where she's headed is within our grasp. As soon as you give the orders, my team will continue our pursuit.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: On another note... Pardon me for asking, but to the one listening to this report from behind the screen—are you the head, or... the Duke herself?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Very sharp of you. I don't remember how many years it's been since I last met a youth who could single that out.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Pardon me, I'd just like to enjoy this cup of tea first. Come, take a seat.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: No, being Infected, I'm best off standing here.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: When you came, did you see the little theater on the street corner?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes, I did... It wasn't open, and no suspicious persons were loitering there.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: That theater was built by a group of self-proclaimed Taran artists. Every night, they put on plays based on Taran culture there.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do you need me to investigate them?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: No, their existence is one I much admire.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: As for capturing the Draco, you needn't worry. I'll have someone else take care of it. The intelligence you brought is highly valuable. Given your talents, we shouldn't be wasting your time on clean-up work.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I would like you to surveil the Duke of Wellington's movements from a specified location.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Understood. I thank you for your appreciation.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Oh, yes, as for our prior question. Have you decided on your answer?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Hi, Miss Messenger, how far can you deliver letters? As far as you want?
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: Could you help me write one, then?
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: Just a word or two. I just want to let my family know I'm still alive...
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: I'm sure you heard the farmer just now. Caravans pass through this area regularly. There'll be one in half an hour.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Follow the caravan, and if you can hide in their transports, all the better. The regions around County Oak Grove should be the Duke of Wellington's territory. He won't permit transgressions against the Tarans.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You'll be in grave danger if you miss this chance. The search team will make their way here from the nearest nomadic city as quickly as they can. It won't take them even an hour.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But if you manage to make it out, you won't have to worry about your future. It's me who they're after. If they lose track of you, they won't pursue you any further.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Er, wait... so, when Bagpipe said you were Dublinn's Leader, that wasn't just me hearing things?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Yes. If any of you still want to fight alongside Dublinn, you can come with me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But Dublinn's name won't shield you, and the road ahead may be much the same as what we're experiencing now... monitored by many, continually chased.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hey, I'm back.
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: I did what you said and talked to her. Said everyone who escaped the village with me decided to settle down here, and made up a place name that doesn't exist in the Scáthanna Fields.
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: Still, that Messenger seemed a nice lass, though... If she's an actual Messenger, not just someone here to investigate us, we'd be sending her on this trip in vain, no?
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: ...I've spent most of my life in hiding. I've seen plenty of people in pursuit, disguising themselves as Messengers.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *sigh* Alright. Suppose that's how it is from now on.
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: Stop sighing so much. We need to divvy up our supplies while we've still got the time.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: And you're hurt. Don't force yourself to go with Reed. We'll fight the Tarans' fight for you.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Haha. I count as having fought for the Tarans, then, eh...?
attributes.name: Injured Refugee

attributes.content: ...Reed, a moment?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Something I need to tell you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I'd wrote about it in my will, but... *sigh*... well, I survived, so.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Mm. What is it?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You see... I was the one who bashed the soldier with the hoe. I'm the reason everyone has to go on the run.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: That night, I saw him beating—beating the Tullys' little girl. So I picked up a hoe someone set aside, and beat him on the head.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I'm shaking, aren't I? I... *sigh* I really am sorry. It's been so long, and I still dream about it.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: She was only fourteen. She was screaming, crying, and it... it got to me.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know I figured, it was so dark out, no lamps allowed and all, so it didn't matter if it might've cracked his skull, shed some blood. Wouldn't have seen it no matter how bad it was.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I just... didn't expect I'd mess this up for so many people.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Afterwards, I thought I'd go with them and try to help everyone settle down, and then I'd leave to atone for my mistakes...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: But some of us never even made it, in the end, to a place we could settle down.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Did you make up the charge—about not having your papers in order?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *sigh*. I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I was worried they'd be suspicious when I wasn't on the wanted posters initially. That's why I went to the pharmacy with Fergal... and then I dragged you into this mess too.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Don't say that, Fionn. My identity was bound—to catch up to me one day.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And the Tarans' sorrow—is bound to catch up to everyone, one day.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Alright... alright, alright.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hey, Moran. Do you want to...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: What is it, Fionn?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: No, nothing. Here, pass me the rope. You won't get very far tying up your luggage up like that.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Heheh. Fine, you're the expert.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: So, you're following Reed into the fight?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Mm. Selmon said I've got the strength to get a lot of things done for them.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But you can't see when there's no light... That'll be hard on you.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Besides, it's war we're talking about. You'll face far more, far greater enemies than we did that night.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: The cannons, too. War isn't like the plays, where the heroes take a cut, bleed a drop, fall and climb back up. In real life, people die the ugliest deaths in no time...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: But. This is the path I want to choose.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I rarely ever get the chance to choose, and I want to take it.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: The caravan's coming in.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Okay, I'll negotiate with them to carry the injured.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Reed... Can I go?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Can I leave, the way I am now?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I believe everything is prepared.
All that's left... is my little sister. She is still lost at a crossroads, but she will make the right decision in the end.
Top Deck of High-Speed Battleship Gastrell

A rib taken from what was once the greatest nomadic city, furnished with the crystallization of the Victorian military's technological prowess. Most should be proud of having the privilege to board this battleship.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Even across all of Terra, I doubt there exists a military machine as worthy of admiration as this.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I expect no less from something bearing the name of a legendary officer under the Draco.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I'm sure many have sought to track it, trying to fathom where you stand...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But after a seven year journey, today is finally the day it comes to shore.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: How many Messengers are on the way to report the news of our change of course?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster and many others besides are paying close attention, but none of their armies will be able to interfere in time.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: County Oak Grove has stopped sailing and is ready to link. This is the first time in seven years our ship comes anywhere close to a nomadic city, but there'll be little resupplying or maintenance needed while we're docked.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: His Lordship has indicated he'll personally receive you at the dock.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Those Aslan lapdogs. So hesitant, so indolent, they may never even find out who this city truly belongs to until this ship has made it to County Oak Grove.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: And they have no idea of the fires that will rise again thence.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Dublinn's army, the Tarans who thirst to be released from this injustice, have made their way here from every part of Victoria.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My strategist... has done very well.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Has my city stopped where I hoped it to?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Yes. Given terrain limitations and safety considerations, this is the position closest to the ruins that this city's course can reach.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: What do you think, Princess Eblana? You paid those ruins a visit on your way here.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: I think this will suffice. It doesn't matter how highly those who clamor for the restoration of Taran culture think of King Gaeil's palace. It's ultimately no more than a decaying ruins.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: When the time comes, the romanticist dreamers need only catch one glimpse of it through the wild morning mist, and it will sink in that what once stood atop the hills perished in Catastrophe. That will do.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: From what I hear, once the Taran dynasty fell and the Dracos fled, the Aslans let that castle stand empty until the day Catastrophe claimed it. The Tarans have all but forgotten it.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The remnants of that olden dynasty... were never of any intrigue to begin with.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The title of King Gaeil was bestowed upon him by Victoria's regent. He was no more than a more celebrated servant. If his crown was still extant, I would destroy it. If his throne still remained, I would render it ashes.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But the place lacks even those to speak of.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Hence why the young Warwick sought to rediscover Taran history starting from the legend of King Gaeil. A fine thing to do, really.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You mean 'The Eulogist' Warwick, the 'Warwick of the Northern Front?' ...Oh, so you knew him?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I once sent an envoy to one of his parties. This battleship began its patrol right around that time.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You've always been of great foresight.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I'd hardly call it much of a long wait.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: County Oak Grove... Say, are you keen on seeing it for yourself?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Of course. I'm very curious how it's rebuilt itself since that great fire.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: After all, I once called it home.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My elder sister's spear in hand, I stand in the hallway for some time.
Everyone in the manor hangs their heads in silence, trying to keep busy. The moment they see me, they avert their gaze.

Our teacher's health has been poor. He hasn't left his room since making his way back through a snowstorm from a dinner party. Dr. Dale readied him the mulled wine, yet hasn't been punctual in fetching the empty glass.
The muted sounds of crackling wood seep through the gaps in the door. The fireplace must be a bed of warmth on this snowy night, but the flames' eerie silence makes my teeth chatter.
Nonetheless, I open the door.
Now that—you've convinced everyone to turn against me... Why shouldn't I partake in this glass of wine?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: I thought you would want to know what your missteps were, such that your servants would seek help from me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: *cough*... That is no matter, Eblana...
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: What is important is... can you continue to hold their trust?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Yes, of course.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And I see you don't ask why I would agree to help them.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: *cough*... I'm sure you know what's going to happen to this city once I'm gone.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: The balance of power between the nobles will be lost, and no one will dare to oppose Count Philip in Parliament. Still, our own two junior barons will no doubt set to work in the shadows, so as to earn the Duke of Stafford's favor.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And simultaneously, the Tarans who have just rediscovered their names will lose their leader and protector.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They will continue to be upheaved, trodden down by the harsh rule of law and the nobles... to the point they cannot bear it.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Yet even if you live, all the bloodshed, the violence, the rioting would happen sooner or later.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Wouldn't you say, sir?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Hohoh... and what will you do when that time comes?
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: I will... reach my hand out, and drag them up from the ashes.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: For some unknown reason, a satisfied smile appears on his pale face.
The insatiable Dracos, their ambitions knowing no bounds... Half my life spent searching. It was not in vain... ahh...
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: He removes his spectacles, and with a slow, arduous turn, faces out through the window, out to the snowstorm.

That gaze, filled with fond nostalgia and earnest expectation, is the same as on that winter night ten years ago, the night he finished reading the legend, the night his fingers brushed across the Taran letters embossed in gold upon the book's spine.
I see... a new age belonging to the Tarans... right in front of us.
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Earl of Warwick
Earl of Warwick
attributes.content: But Loughshinny...

attributes.name: Earl of Warwick
attributes.content: And you...

attributes.name: Earl of Warwick
attributes.content: You...
I stand motionlessly in the doorway. Reflected on the glass pane is my face, illuminated by the cold flames around us.
Though filled with fear, our pitiful expressions are one and the same.
Loughshinny... whose student will you be?
